title: Indochine Chicken Salad

ingredients.content: 30 g fresh root ginger, peeled, cut in round slices (2 mm)
1600 g water, plus extra for soaking
700 g chicken breasts, boneless and skinless, halved on the grain

preparations.content: Place peanuts in mixing bowl and chop <b>4 sec/speed 6<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl and make dressing.
Stir lime juice, palm sugar, chilli, fish sauce and pepper together in a bowl then set aside and continue with recipe.
Place ginger, 60 g onions and garlic in mixing bowl then chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Insert simmering basket. Add chicken then cook <b>25-30 min/80°C/speed <b>. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula. Leave chicken to cool, then cover and refrigerate. Empty mixing bowl.
Place 60 g onion slices in a bowl and cover with cold water. Leave to soak in fridge for 15 minutes, then drain.

Soak noodles in hot water until soft and they come apart easily (approx. 10-15 minutes).  Drain noodles through Varoma dish, rinse in cold water and drain again. Place drained noodles on a board and cut through a few times with a sharp knife.

Once chicken has cooled, place chicken in mixing bowl and shred <b>5-7 sec//speed 3<b>. The chicken should be in pieces approx. 6 cm x 1.5 cm. Transfer to a bowl, dress with half the reserved dressing, add reserved onion slices, mint and coriander. Toss lightly to combine and add more dressing to taste.
Arrange noodles on a serving plateand pile chicken salad on top, working the chicken through the noodles with fingers.  Scatter with reserved chopped peanuts to serve.

hintsAndTricks: The chicken can be cooked a day in advance and placed in the fridge.
Chicken stock can be used to poach the chicken instead of water.
Any leftover chicken can be tossed with some dressing for a classic sandwich.
